definitions.definition: The grammatical mood expressing an order (see jussive ). In English, the imperative form of a verb is the same as that of the bare infinitive.
examples: The verbs in sentences like "Do it!" and "Say what you like!" are in the imperative .

definitions.definition: A verb in the imperative mood.
An essential action, a must : something which is imperative.

main_definition: ( uncountable , grammar ) The grammatical mood expressing an order (see jussive ). In English, the imperative form of a verb is the same as that of the bare infinitive.
secondary_definitions: ( countable , grammar ) A verb in the imperative mood.
( countable ) An essential action, a must : something which is imperative.
